title: CLI GlobalUsings Cleanup Complete
details:
Successfully completed comprehensive using statements cleanup for the CLI project as part of the Program.cs refactoring project:

## Changes Made:

### Main CLI Project (NotebookAutomation.Cli):
- **Updated GlobalUsings.cs** to include all new namespaces created during refactoring:
  - NotebookAutomation.Cli.Cli
  - NotebookAutomation.Cli.Configuration  
  - NotebookAutomation.Cli.Models
  - NotebookAutomation.Cli.Startup
  - NotebookAutomation.Cli.UI
  - NotebookAutomation.Cli.Utilities

- **Cleaned up individual files** by removing redundant using statements:
  - Program.cs: Removed NotebookAutomation.Cli.Startup and NotebookAutomation.Cli.UI
  - Models/CommandLineOptions.cs: Removed System.CommandLine
  - Commands/ConfigCommands.cs: Removed Microsoft.Extensions.Logging
  - Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs: Left alone (special file)

### Test Project (NotebookAutomation.Cli.Tests):
- **Updated GlobalUsings.cs** to include:
  - All new CLI namespaces (Cli, Configuration, Models, Startup, UI)
  - Additional System namespaces (Collections.Generic, Diagnostics, Reflection)
  - Core namespaces (Models, Services, Tools.Vault, Utils)

- **Cleaned up test files** by removing all redundant using statements:
  - UI/HelpDisplayServiceTests.cs: Removed 2 using statements
  - UI/EnvironmentDisplayServiceTests.cs: Removed 5 using statements
  - Configuration/ConfigurationDiscoveryServiceTests.cs: Removed 1 using statement
  - Startup/ApplicationBootstrapperTests.cs: Removed 1 using statement
  - Cli/CommandLineBuilderTests.cs: Removed 2 using statements
  - Commands/VaultCommandsRelativePathTests.cs: Removed 12 using statements
  - Utilities/CommandLineModeDetectorTests.cs: Already clean

## Verification:
- ✅ Build successful: dotnet build NotebookAutomation.sln
- ✅ All 143 CLI tests passing: dotnet test NotebookAutomation.Cli.Tests
- ✅ CLI functionality verified: dotnet run --project NotebookAutomation.Cli -- --help

## Benefits:
- Centralized using statement management
- Reduced code duplication
- Cleaner file headers
- Better maintainability
- Follows modern C# best practices
